drjoliv.fjava.adt

Class Trampoline<A>

  • java.lang.Object
    • drjoliv.fjava.adt.Trampoline<A>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Applicative<Trampoline.μ,A>, Functor<Trampoline.μ,A>, Monad<Trampoline.μ,A>

    public abstract class Trampoline<A>
extends Object
implements Monad<Trampoline.μ,A>
    A container for stackless computation. When writing recursive computations you can use Trampolines to avoid nasty stack overflows. Below is an example of a simple factorial function. Each time fact is called a new frame is put onto the stack, trampolines help us avoid this. 
    
 public static Long fact(Long n) {
  if(n == 0L)
    return 1L;
  else if(n == 1L)
    return 1L;
  else
    return n * fact(n - 1);
 }
    The below code snippet is factorial rewritten using a trampoline. (Note: The below implementation was written to show the stackless nature of trampoilnes not to write a fast implementation of factorial.) 
    
 public static Trampoline<Long> tFact(Long n) {
  if(n == 0L)
    return done(1L);
  else if(n == 1L)
    return done(1L);
  else {
    return more(() -> tFact(n -1).map(i -> n.multiply(i)));
  }
 }
    done(A a) is a function that creates a trampoline that is ready to return a result and more(Trampoline<A>) is a function that creates a trampoline that has more work to do. Mapping over a trampoline is analougouse to creating a trampoine that depends on a previous trampolines result. After constructing a Trampoline use the method Trampoline#result to obtain the final value. 
     fact(100) == tFact(100).result()
    Author:
    Desonte 'drjoliv' Jolivet : drjoliv@gmail.com

      • done$

        public static final <A> Trampoline<A> done$(F0<A> fn)
        Converts a supplier to a trampoine. The value returned by the supplier is the valued use by the trampoline. Trampoline.done(fn.call()) == Trampoline.done$(fn) The supplier is onlly evaluated when needed.
        Parameters:
        fn - the supplier to be wrapped into a trampoline.
        Returns:
        a trampoline.

      • more

        public static <A> Trampoline<A> more(F0<Trampoline<A>> more)
        Creates a trampolline that has more work to be done.
        Parameters:
        more - a supplier that genertates a tramopline. The trampolline generated by the supplier contains subsequent steps for complemeting the computation of the returned trampoline.
        Returns:
        a trampoline that has more to be done.
